name: TheAtlantic
text: "For some current and former Republicans—skeptical of socialism but disgusted by Trump’s pitiless narcissism—a message of bipartisan, ideologically flexible compassion has deep appeal," @PeterBeinart writes: https://t.co/V5s9Y7H7K5

name: TheAtlantic
text: Voice acting has long been under scrutiny about race and representation. But the recent wave of white actors departing from roles that depict characters of color has delivered a shock to the industry, @shirklesxp reports. https://t.co/ieKEjeY0L9

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sure, the creators of anti-racist reading lists mean well. But literature and dialogue cannot supplant restorative social policies and organizational change, @saigrundy writes: https://t.co/FnDF94aMaT
